%
%%  DO NOT EDIT  LINES ABOVE                     %

\begin{abstract}
Prove: There exists a unique function $h:Z \rightarrow A \times B$ such that \\ \centering $f_{1}(z)=\pi_{1} \circ h(z)$ and $f_{2}(z)=\pi_{2} \circ h(z)$.

\noindent\textbf{}

\end{abstract}%

\bgroup
\color{abs}
